OauthTokenExchHandlerApp.name: OauthTokenExchHandlerApp
OauthTokenExchHandlerApp.description: Represents the enablement settings for a specific Salesforce connected app or external client app that’s enabled for the token exchange handler. A handler can be enabled for multiple apps.

ApexExecutionUserId.description: The ID of the user who runs the Apex token exchange handler. We recommend that you use an integration user.

ConnectedApplicationId.description: The connected app that’s being used to integrate with Salesforce.

IsDefault.description: Indicates whether the token exchange handler is the default handler for this app. During the token exchange flow, in the token request, you can optionally include a token_handler parameter with the name of a specific handler’s Apex class. If you don’t include this parameter, Salesforce defaults to the default handler.

OauthTokenExchangeHandlerId.description: The OauthTokenExchangeHandler with which these enablement settings are associated.
